reviewText:
Smite is a very unique MOBA(Multiplayer Online Battle Arena)in the sense that you are in the 3rd person perspective instead of the traditional top down perspective. I think this makes smite a easier MOBA for people that haven't played any MOBAs before.
The controls are also very different from other MOBAs. In Smite you control your god with the WASD keys. This is another reason that Smite is better for newer MOBA fans.
The overall gameplay is very good for Smite. The teams are usually ballanced and it is not difficult to make friends with people in game. Most of the community is really nice. There probably would be a learning curve if the community wasn't so helpful. HiRez studios reallu does listen to the the community very well. There are a varity of skins that are community sugestions.
In conclusion, Smite is a very different type of MOBA. While others have tried and failed this, Smite succeded. The community is very good and I sugest this too you whether you are just getting into MOBAs or have been with them from the start.

reviewText:
This is probably one of my favorite F2P games to date.  SMITE is a 3rd person action MOBA with varios different game modes available with a viable F2P monetization system that won't hinder anyone who decides to not spend any real money.

PROS
-Various Game Modes Including 3v3, 4v4, 5v5 (Mostly 5v5)
-A new god added every 2 weeks, currently over 50+
-Very Good Free to Play Monetization that won't hinder new players
-Worth Trying at least once
-Actually learn about real world mythology & lore

CONS
-Some pay items/skins are in random loot chests only
-May take time getting into
-Hi-Rez has a mixed reputation among some fans

GAMEPLAY

Smite plays pretty much like every other MOBA with the exception of the camera.  Instead of an overhead style viewpoint you get a 3rd person action oriented style game which is a lot more fun & easy to play with than the traditional overhead style.  No constant clicking here.  You just aim with the mouse, click to attack & press buttons for abilities.  It plays how you'd expect a 3rd person action game to play & it flows really well.

Like any other MOBA it also has a hub menu which you use to make groups & queue for game modes.  Most game modes queue in under a minute or within a few seconds so you won't have to wait very long.  It's also used for buying things such as gods, skins, boosters & loot chests.  The game also has some skins you can get for free through the recruit a friend system.

MONETIZATION

There are two types of currency.  Gems being the real cash currency & the other being the Free currency that you earn by playing matches & leveling up.  Every few levels you will unlock a reward whether it's more points, some free gems or a new god.  It's mostly just points.  Periodically the game will give you free boosters to increase XP & the amount of points you earn.  You can also get 50 free gems every week simply by logging into the game giving you a chance to earn up to 2600 free gems total every year.  Pretty generous compared to other games like LoL or HotS which don't give any free paid currency.

Of course, even with all the freebies the game still has a lot of incentive for spending real money.  Such as limited time offers, bonus skins for buying a new skin within the first week & exclusive skins which can only be earned during certain events.  All of which will cost you a pretty penny, for sure.  You may not have enough free gems saved up to get what you really want & if you miss out you may not be able to get that skin ever again.  They do come back eventually but only through random loot chests usually during holidays.  The bonus exclusive skins however are usually only for early adopters.  So, if you really want a recolor of a certain epic skin you'd have to buy it on it's release.

How they release skins & tempt you with bonus skins does feel like they are trying to milk you dry but you gotta remember everything they are selling is purely cosmetic & does not impact actual gameplay.  Some skins are really cool though & I wish I could have bought some exclusive skins when they came out but I couldn't & now those skins aren't buyable unless they are in random loot chests during events.  It really feels like a big Haves/Havenots" type of system & I personally don't like it very much.

GAME MODES

Arena 5v5-  The first game mode you get to play after the tutorial (if you're a new player) arena is a large open 5v5 map that has a big emphasis on gladiator rome.  The goal is to drain the enemy teams points first.  This can be achieved by escorting minions into the enemy portal or getting kills.  Every god kill is 5 points while every minion is 1 point.  Getting a friendly minion through a portal is another point.  You used to be able to destroy towers for 15 points but they got rid of that due to spawn camping or something.  Not really sure. In exchange they added a new seige spawn that is worth 10 points. Matches in this mode average around 15-20 minutes.

Conquest 5v5- The standard game mode but not the most popular.  A 3 lane map with 2 towers in each team's lane & one phoenix which is a more powerful tower that guards the Titan.  The goal is to get to the enemy's base & beat their titan.  This game mode requires a lot of team work
date: strategy & know how.  Usually a team consists of 1 Guardian & 1 Hunter in the long lane
hoursPlayed: 1 Assassin for the Jungle
voteText: & 1 Warrior in the short lane but team set ups may vary depending on who's playing.  Matches in this mode can last over 20 minutes & sometimes push to an hour.\n\nAssault 5v5- The most popular game mode.  One lane
helpfulPercent: no jungle
votesHelpful: 5 players
votesTotal:
Random Draw.  Goal is destroy the enemy Titan. You also can't warp back to the base & shop for items in this mode.  You have to die to buy more stuff.  The strategy in this mode is mostly luck of the draw mixed with good team battle practice. Matches in this mode are usually pretty quick & can last anywhere from 5 to 20 minutes on average.

Siege 4v4-  This mode is similar to conquest except it's 2 lanes & it's 4v4.  The goal is to destroy the enemy's titan.  The main difference here is every now & then you'll get a Seige monster in your lane that will help bumrush down towers.  You'll also need to defend your lane when the enemy team gets a seige weapon.  There's also a silver fury in the center of the map which gives the team that lands the final blow a free seige weapon to push a lane.  If you get lucky & time it right you can get two of them at once.  Average match time is around 20 minutes but I've had some push around 45 or so.

Clash 5v5- Probably the worst & funniest game mode.  It's also the newest so that's to be expected.  A 5v5 match with 2 lanes
votesFunny: it's basically conquest but requires less strategy & has a higher emphasis on team battles.  It feels kind of like a fustercluck though.  I've only played this mode once & I didn't really care for it.\n\nJoust- a 3v3 map with one middle lane & two jungle lanes.  Not my favorite mode but not my least favorite either. Same goal as nearly every other mode
commentsCount: defeat the enemy Titan.  Matches can range from 15-20 minutes on average.\n\nDomination 5v5- This match type no longer exists.  It sometimes reapears in MOTD but that's about it.  The goal is to capture points & hold them.  Three capture points total
column16: holding 2 or 3 of the areas is required to get a lead.  Match times averaged around 25 minutes.\n\nMOTD 5v5-  A different match every day with different rules.  Sometimes it's unlimited gold
column17: sometimes it's all Thors.  Sometimes it's fun & sometimes it's not.  It's mostly here to spice things up for people who play on a daily basis which a lot of people do.\n\nLEAGUE 5v5-  League matches are Arena & Conquest only at the time of this review.  This is the mode to play if you want to be ranked & is best played with a group of friends.  You can pug if you want
column18: though.  Same rules apply with normal Arena & Conquest but harsher punishments for those who afk or leave mid match.  Also
column19:
there's a ban-pick before each game that involves choosing & locking certain gods from being played.  This is the most strategy heavy game mode & is only available to players who have reached level 30.  No noobs allowed.

OVERALL

I've bought & played all of Hi-Rez's games such as Global Agenda & Tribes Ascend but Smite is by far the best game they've made to date & is worth checking out.  The downside to me playing their older games is that they were abandoned for them to work on other projects.  E.G.  GA was abandoned to work on Tribes & Tribes was abandoned to work on Smite.  Smite however doesn't seem to be having any abandonment issues.  Still
column20: even with Hi-Rez's track record Smite is most Definately worth your time.  I have been playing it since early open beta & it's only gotten better as time went on.  Give it a look!  I'd go more in depth but I ran out of space for this review."

reviewText:
A MOBA which is fast and quick to learn, fairly hard to master, and has a good variety of ways to play.

8/10

Pros:
-Easy to learn
-Communication is made very easy in text
-User friendly interface
-Good in-game currecny model, fairly easy to aquire chara=cters for free, and the character bundle is the price of a AAA game (so its worth it)
-Lots if lore if thats your thing
-Good voice acting
-Suitable graphics, but not spectacular (it is a MOBA)
-Sound is decent, sometimes the levels are poor

Cons:
-Often frustrating matchmaking
-At times buggy, but stable
-Smaller player base than other MOBA's
-Poor balance leads to similar playstyles for many characters
-Dated UI style
-No proper in-built support for microphones

reviewText:
I've been playing smite for the last 2 years and im currently Masters,Smite is alot of fun to play with friends but when your solo q'ing there's not many good players

Pros:
Very fun/addictive game.
Daily logins give you gems so you can buy stuff
Patches every 2 weeks or so(regular content updates)
Alot of different gamemodes to play
You can buy the god pack for about £20 something like that, its SUCH a good deal because you unlock all gods & all future gods too
The esports scene is HUGE right now, theres not many good teams apart from the spl teams so you definetly all have a shot at it
Every year they release a thing called '' The Odyssey'' where you can purchase several items and it contributes to the esports prize pool making it bigger
Hirez listen's to the community on what they think is ''op'' and what needs adjustment and they fix it quickly, although they dont listen to the pros they only listen to the general smite community

Cons:
Matchmaking at a higher level is pretty much garbage
The way ranked works, the tp system AND matchmaker are broken
The servers for EU are pretty trash
For a game that has over 10 million players, there's WAY too many bugs still in the game
Very difficult for newbies to learn e.g builds, what abilites to max first, where to start in conquest
Boosters and Ward skins are stupid,they dont give you any benefits apart from 2 extra worshippers per game and a fancy looking ward (who cares?)its basically a way to take money

Overall I think smite is a super fun to play game but i've played around 5000 games + and it starts to get boring, although you should definetly give it a shot :)

reviewText:
Smite is one pretty special game for me... I once decided to try League of Legends and well... It didn't work out it was boring and I really didn't wanted to click more because I felt it missed some action. And then I decided to try out DOTA 2 but it was the same boring gameplay and it was just not quite fun for me.

Then.
A.
Miracle.
Happened.

I decided to try out this brand new MOBA called 'Smite' which wasn't exactly brand new because it was still on beta and hell it was a lot of fun.

The game occurs in this third person view and makes most of the skill into shooting skillshots at the right times, and that really increasses the amount of action you get from the game which I feel like it makes the game fun to play, This camera also changes a lot of the gameplay stuff like hiding is now different and jukes are pretty interesting...

The game isn't perfect because it still a bit unbalanced but at least it's fun to play and I think thats what matters, Community is pretty good, not perfect but better than the Leagues one and this is probably the first game in which I see russians are nice lmao.

8.6/10

column18: though.  Same rules apply with normal Arena & Conquest but harsher punishments for those who afk or leave mid match.  Also
column19:
there's a ban-pick before each game that involves choosing & locking certain gods from being played.  This is the most strategy heavy game mode & is only available to players who have reached level 30.  No noobs allowed.

OVERALL

I've bought & played all of Hi-Rez's games such as Global Agenda & Tribes Ascend but Smite is by far the best game they've made to date & is worth checking out.  The downside to me playing their older games is that they were abandoned for them to work on other projects.  E.G.  GA was abandoned to work on Tribes & Tribes was abandoned to work on Smite.  Smite however doesn't seem to be having any abandonment issues.  Still
column20: even with Hi-Rez's track record Smite is most Definately worth your time.  I have been playing it since early open beta & it's only gotten better as time went on.  Give it a look!  I'd go more in depth but I ran out of space for this review."

reviewText:
A MOBA which is fast and quick to learn, fairly hard to master, and has a good variety of ways to play.

8/10

Pros:
-Easy to learn
-Communication is made very easy in text
-User friendly interface
-Good in-game currecny model, fairly easy to aquire chara=cters for free, and the character bundle is the price of a AAA game (so its worth it)
-Lots if lore if thats your thing
-Good voice acting
-Suitable graphics, but not spectacular (it is a MOBA)
-Sound is decent, sometimes the levels are poor

Cons:
-Often frustrating matchmaking
-At times buggy, but stable
-Smaller player base than other MOBA's
-Poor balance leads to similar playstyles for many characters
-Dated UI style
-No proper in-built support for microphones

MOBAs suck.

date: with the justification that "It has a steep learning curve" or "You just don't get it." Well they're right. I don't. I don't see how a anyone can consider a game where one person can wipe each and every team fight

reviewText:
I've tried LoL, DOTA and a few other MOBA's, but I just couldn't get into the isometric click-fest. After having played the beta I gave SMITE another shot when it launched 1,5 years ago and I never looked back. More than a 1000 hrs later I'm still playing every single day.

It will take you some time and practice to get used to it all, but It's more accessible compared to other MOBA's due to it having less items and being able to turn on auto-buy/level. Positioning is a big part of being successful as well as aiming, timing, communication and synergy making it hard to master.

The game is based on mythology from 7 different pantheons and the 69 gods (at the time of writing) all have lore related directed taunts, which adds a lot of humour to the mix. 5 different classes, 8 game-modes on 5 different maps offer something to enjoy for everyone.

Regular updates and patches keep the game fresh. With plenty of free gems" events and sales you won't need to spend tonnes of cash on cosmetics if you don't want to. (I have accumulated 1000s of gems and free stuff in my playtime)

Being the 3rd Biggest MOBA with 2nd largest tournament prizepools in e-sports history I think I can safely say Hi-Rez finally hit the right spot with this game.

The only negative things I can think of are that on a rare occasion the servers lag and sometimes matchmaking can be a bit wonky
date: which isn't too big of a deal if you don't play ranked leagues. As with any online game you get a few toxic players every now and then
recommended: but they can easily be muted or ignored and more often than not you will find nice and reasonable folk in your matches.\n\nFurthermore I can reccommend playing/queueing with friends. Once you get used to the 3rd person and aiming
hoursPlayed: turn off auto-buy/level and use sites like Tiermonster.com for item builds. The bots in co-op game-modes are horribly bad
voteText:
get into PvP as soon as possible. Read some guides and watch streams to improve your game. If you enjoy the game get "the ultimate god pack" (unlocks all gods+future gods) it's the best deal in moba games.

[VVGL] Good Luck
[VVGF] Have fun!

9/10 would kappa again."

reviewText: I know my steam play time is low but I've been playing this game for a solid amount of time before this released here and I love it so much. The gods are all so cool and the mythology adds a fun layer with the characters plus actually seeing the skins you have on your god is pretty great. The motd is a fun addition because it spices things up a little if you don't want to play a traditional game mode, which Smite has a solid amount of. The daily log in bonus is great because I haven't spent a penny on this game and I have a bunch of gods and skins and ward skins and icons. If you're someone who doesn't like MOBAs I would suggest you give this one a try because it might just click for you. That all being said, it seems the steam version might be a bit iffy right now so you may want to wait and download it from Hi Rez, either way, I hope you play this game.

reviewText:
Been playing since 2012 Closed Beta with atleast over 2500hours played and SMITE has become one of my favorite games.
Why?
One of the most unique games I have seen, like always Hi-Rez has done, but this time a MOBA in 3rd person.
69 gods to play with. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) Everyone from different pantheons, 7 pantheons.
Hi-Rez listen what the community wants/needs into the game.
Their game does not need a beast pc to run.
Everything micro-transaction related is quite well rewarding, for example, the God Pack, you unlock all current gods and future gods for a really nice price(My biggest investment into SMITE and I dont regret it).
They give out free gems once in a while.
The minus parts that I only found is that I need to open the launcher with the Steam version, no account migration or etc. and some toxic people. Otherwise this game is awesome with their uniqueness.
Now with the Steam release(which I and alot of people thought wont come) I can now finally sell my CS:GO skins and get gems. ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
This game is worth a try, I got a beta invite, I gave it a chance and yeah... 10/10 would ruin my life again.

reviewText:
The MOBA of the future.

It combines all of the high intensity game play of an RTS with the lane pushing, character depth and objective based play of its other MOBA brethren and rounded out with an almost fully skill shot based kit out of all gods COMPLETE with the skills required for shooters in the form of the auto attacks!

If you want to get away from the shonky balancing of League of Legends, looking for a game that requires a different play style than Counter Strike and don't want to learn the intense intricacies of DOTA? Well Smite fills all of those niches AND it even plays it out in the universe of all gods in a range of mythologies!

See you on the battlefield player!

reviewText:
OMG MY LIFE IS COMPLETE NOW
I've been waiting for Smite to be released on Steam for so long and I really hope this game becomes popular. It brings a whole new unique perspective into the world of MOBA and this game mostly relies on skillshots (except for Neith's ult) which I find fascinating. The gods/goddesses in this game are really detailed and fun to use. I prefer the 3rd person cam instead of the bird's eye view - it makes it harder to see what's behind me. They have a plethora of voice commands (it may be hard at first but after some time it'd be drilled into the back of your head) making it easy to communicate and purchasable voice packs to go along with it. There are also many outside references (ex: Khepri's victory dance with the cyclops aka Jake dancing with the beetle from Adventure Time) and taunts to specific gods. The community is farrrrrr better than LoL and the game mechanics are fairly simple. Not to mention, they have many events where they give out free gems!

(If I hear another fanboy saying that Smite ripped from LoL I will literally go insane)

reviewText:
Good Stuff
I've been playing this game on and off since Beta. I never got really into it since I was super into League of Legends.
But since i've put my League days behind me I've picked this game up again.

I can honestly say that SMITE is a much more enjoyable experience than other MOBAs out there. The community doesn't make me want to shoot myself, the gameplay is interesting with it's third person view, and the game is simple enough for anyone to pick up. I've been playing SMITE casually with some friends and it's been an all around fun time for all of us. There was not a single person telling us to Die and get cancer".

My only real gripes with the game are for the business model. It's both fantastic and a little bit wonky. In SMITE you can buy the Ultimate God Pack
date: which gives you every God and every God that will ever come out
recommended: this is probably the best thing you could buy in any MOBA ever. But there's also these chests with limited skins in them that come out once a year or during pro season. They're like crates in TF2 or CSGO
hoursPlayed: you have a chance to get the rare skin that's super limited or the one that you could've bought for cheaper in store. Also there's a lot of Limited skins that'll  NEVER  be released again
voteText:
this is a let down because a lot of them are cool skins. Oh and Odyssey. F*ck Odyssey

Now you might be saying "It's just skins why do they matter" I just want to look cool okay? But besides that the game is fantastic.

Final Verdict
This game is super fun to play

reviewText:
Played this game a bunch before. I even played in the close beta. This is a unique MOBA, with it´s Third person view as a main part of this game, also the huge amount of gods (with more gods to be add in the future) that can be obtained, it´s voice packs and skins.

The gamemodes of this game are Arena, Assault, Joust 3vs3, Siege(4vs4), the Match of The Day and Conquest, the main mode, tho if you want to play competitive, there is also the League Joust (1vs1) and League Conquest.

The cons for this game,  common in other MOBAs like LoL, is the community , the balance issues with new gods and the servers (High ping).
So if ya like MOBAs but want to experience it in another way, get this game, it isn´t gonna dissapoint ya.

reviewText: I started playing Smite about a year ago, and I was hooked instantly. The concept of MOBAs had always intrigued me, but I struggled to enjoy the ones I tried because of the mouse movement controls and isometric viewpoint, among other reasons. When I heard Smite was a 3rd-person, WASD-controlled MOBA with an emphasis on skillshots, I had to try it, and I'm glad I did. The game is a fantastic team-oriented experience with a great depth of stragegy/gameplay/skill. The character design and implementation is amazing, the lore of mythological gods battling is a blast, and the variety of abilities, skills, gamemodes, events, etc. has kept me coming back for more ever since I started. Try it - you won't be disappointed!

reviewText: I have never really written a review for any game on steam, but this game breaks that mold, in fact it breaks lots of molds in the MOBA genre in all. Its a MOBA game that uses a third person camera at all times, while this may seem like a quirky gimmic that makes the game uninteresting in a few moments of gameplay it does not. It always keeps my attention and I waste hours playing this game without even realising it and thats the thing. Whenever I try to play any other MOBA game (Dota 2/League of Legends) I get bored quickly because I feel like the action just isnt there. This game on the contrary is always filled with excitment and im always on my toes when I play this game. All of the Basic attacks are whats called skill shots" meaning you have to aim in order to kill anyone in this game. Unlike other MOBA games you do not click on the ground to move
date: instead you move with the WASD keys and you have to option to re bind them to something else. Currently the game has about 69 Gods to play as from different pantheons. Gods are essentially your character that you can choose to play as or a "Champion" if you will and they all look and sound Great! Hell the entire game looks amazing even when everything was turned down on low! The game modes vary from conquest (5V5) to Joust (3V3) and if that isnt enough you have a MOTD or a "mode of the day" which should add a little something to your life if you ever get bored of Classic 5V5. A MOTD is a random mode with the rules changed whether it be Extra money or all one character or a mode where everyone is already to the max level. In the end I could keep going about how amazing this game is ( I have played this for like a gazillion hours before it even came to steam) Or I could just end on saying
recommended: if you want to try a MOBA game thats a little diffrent but still fun Smite is your game!"
hoursPlayed: September 8, 2015

reviewText:
- Fast paced MOBA in the third person perspective. Very unique and much fun at once. Such action.
- The characters are Gods from 7 different Pantheons and all are almost unique compared to others individually.
- A very good F2P price model. A pack offers you all currently released and future gods for a set price and you can spend your ingame money on other stuff. Mostly cosmetics. No pay to win in this game.
- Hi-Rez (Devs behind the game) are very kind and generous to it's players. Lots of free rewards and stuff.
- Constantly beeing patch with new content. No end in sight just yet.
- Meta is constantly changing, a meta never last really long.
- eSport scene is thriving and watching pro players playing the game on high ranked play is a joy.

There's not much complain about, other than:

- Community can be toxic sometimes. Mute and ignore if you can. This problem exist in every MOBA however.
- Game has tad bit of optimization problems with AMD cards from what I can tell. Still, runs really well on older rigs.

Love this game. I've been playing since Beta, took a break however (was playing League of Legends competetive at the time) and came 4 months ago back to it. I would recommend it to everyone who enjoys MOBA's with a very unique aspect. 9/10

reviewText:
A truly nice and lovely game!

I've been playing SMITE since the Closed Beta and already have over 750 hours on my back and  I have to say, it never really got boring to me!
+++
+ Voicepacks: They do a great job and you really have the opportunity to communicate good with your team!
The variations for each GOD  that there is an own voicepack to buy (with Gems) makes it even more funnier to talk with your allies!
+ I really love the company HiRez-Studions, they do a great job with everything (except one thing) and they still have the time to do funny videos that they can upload on YouTube then!
+ Aswell as the pantheons:
To explore all the different GODS, to read the lore and just getting known the varieties that there are!
+ The Gameplay is nice to, teaming up with friends or non-friends isn't that much of a different if you have the right people to fight your enemy team and the dynamic in Third-Person makes it much more epic to fight!

---
- The matchmaking for League (Ranked Games for some people) is still a problem. Getting queued with people who just started to play League Matches sometimes makes me feel sad and is a thing that the company needs to fix! ;)

There is nothing more to say for me, 9/10 SMITE from HiRez-Studios!

reviewText:
Smite is one of the most ambitious, and creative MOBAs on the market right now. It takes a very different turn with the thrid person perspective which can make it feel more of an action game than a MOBA. This isn't bad however, since there can be a very large skill gap for new players, and expierenced ones. This leads to it being very fun when you first start out, and it almost feels like an action game, but as you progress, you learn more about the game and devolp strategies and ways to make the game easier.

If you find the game getting stale, switch up your god selection. A lot of players quit this game, because they think it gets stale quickly, however they usually stick to one god or class type. There is a lot of content if you branch out from what you are comfortable playing.

The lore in this game is amazing, it is the reason why I got into it, I saw I could play as Thor, and Posideon and went estatic. BTW, just lettting you know sadly, Zeus is a fairly bad mage, even though he is one of the most iconic gods in Greek mythology.

Give this game a try, you have nothing to lose, the free to play aspect is all there, you are able to rent gods at a very satisfying rate with the in game currency, and skins are the only things that cost money. If you love the game, the god pack is very worth it, and it is better if you buy it sooner than later when you start playing.

reviewText: Basically SMITE is a mixture of mmo battleground gameplay and the character variety of MOBAs. Unlike battlegrounds though you must aim every shot even your 'autos' and unlike other mobas your characters are classic gods, some that you know and love and others you enjoy experiencing lore for the first time. It has an active and passionate community and is updated regularly. There are no in game advantages (runes/masteries) for people that have played for years, so your skill (and your teammates) is the only deciding factor in how well you do. Its a great game and definitely worth a try. Happy smiting!

reviewText:
I have been playing Smite since the release of closed BETA. I can honestly say it is my favorite competitive game I have ever played. I used to play LoL but I fell out of love and started looking for something else. I tried DOTA but it never spoke to me. Smite speaks to me as a guy who plays action games like shooters and fighting games.

- Controls feel great and the perspective feels natural. New players might feel awkward moving due to the movement penalty for strafing and backpedaling but you quickly get used to it and learn why it is there. Almost every attack is a skillshot that you have to aim including the basic attacks. This means that crazy plays and exciting moments are much more common in Smite.
- The gods have amazing designs and have expressive personalities. Ratatoskr is adorable. Sun Wukong is awesome. Nu Wa is beautiful. Hel is funny. You get the idea. Being able to play one of your favorite gods is a big draw.
- The game is fast paced and with lots of action. There is always someone to fight and the main Conquest map encourages more fighting and less farming than other MOBAs.
- Game length can vary. They average about 25 minutes but low level games can drag on on to 50 minutes. Games where everyone on one team is doing well can end in 10 minutes.
- The game features lots of other game modes. Arena for quick TDM type play. Siege for a simpler version of the main mode. Assault for all random characters down a single lane. 3v3 and 1v1 joust. Finally a Mode of the Day for a new crazy game mode every day. 80% CDR with only Zeus? Why not?
- Frequent updates (2 every month) keep the game fresh and balanced. The balance is well done and almost every god is viable. New players might get frustrated against gods like Anubis and Ares but you will learn how to fight them (and how to buy actives).
- The game has tutorials and practice modes with simple AI so you can get used to the controls and getting used to the mechanics. If you don't want to worry about items or leveling your skills, you can set the game to auto level them for you. You can even change what the game buys and levels for you before a match and of course turn it off altogether. This allows the game to be much easier to learn than most other MOBAs.

Overall if you prefer your games fast paced or don't like traditional MOBAs, give this one a shot. You don't have to play the main MOBA mode and you can stick to Arena or any of the other modes. The perspective should feel natural for players who like shooters or players who like MMOs. Even if you don't think you like MOBAs, Smite is different enough in a lot of ways that it might change your opinion.

reviewText:
WHY YOU MIGHT WANT TO PLAY SMITE
- Third person, over the shoulder perspective. This is pretty big, and in my opinion, the game's biggest selling point. With one or two exceptions, abilities are all skillshots, and autoattacks have to be aimed. Direct control over your character is a much more enjoyable control scheme than click to move. (The downside to this is that you can't switch control or move the camera, so you'll never see a character like Lone Druid).
- Multiple game modes. If you like the aesthetic and controls but hate the idea of playing a traditional 3-lane 5v5 matchup, you can still hop into Arena (5v5 deathmatch. Giant circle, kill the enemy team more than they kill you), Assault (Smite's ARAM mode, 5v5 with a single lane and gods randomly assigned), Seige (4v4, two lanes with a single objective), or Joust (3v3, single lane with small jungles). There's also the Match of the Day, which can be anything from a 4v4 match on the normal 5v5 map, or Arena with 80% cooldown reduction and inifinte mana.
- Generous handouts. For $30, you can get all current and future gods. Every god has one recolor, and three mastery" skins (gold
hoursPlayed: available for purchase with in game money. If you log in every day for a week
voteText: you'll get a total of 50 gems
helpfulPercent: and there are frequently sales and free gem weekends.\n- The VGS. Enemy leave your lane? Tap out VFF and your character will call out "Enemy missing!". The VGS is a convienience you won't know you're missing until you load up any other competitive game without the same level of communication tools.\n- Autobuy / Autolevel. If you don't want to sweat about what you should build or what skills you should level

reviewText:
Been playing Smite for almost 3 years now. It is awesome.
I have dabbled in many MOBAs (DoTA, LoL, Awesomenauts, Monday Night Combat) and have enjoyed all of them, but there are just a number of things that set Smite apart:

1. The theme is awesome. Ever since I played Age of Mythology as a kid I've really liked mythology as a theme. These gods are just so memorable and interesting. Smite really lets them come to life, while also introducing you to many gods you have never even heard of.

2. It's all a matter of perspective. At the end of the day, games are meant to be fun. And killing someone in Smite just feels SO MUCH MORE satisfying than it does in other MOBAs. Landing skillshots in 3rd person is much more viceral and impactful than it is in top down MOBAs.

3. Good mechanics, without cumbersome mechanics: Unlike the big two (no names needed), Smite is not cumbersome. Buying an item does not require you to know what other 4 items need to be combined to make it. Beginners can simply turn on an auto buy" feature in order to ease the learning curve. To buy stuff you just go to base and buy it. simple as that. No need for secret shops in the jungle
recommended: two core mechanics: last hitting and denial are wonderfully handled: Last hitting gives you more gold
hoursPlayed: but you also get gold for being close to enemies as they die
voteText: making farming less of a hassle. And
helpfulPercent: more importantly: there is no denial. I know some DoTA players have strong feelings about this
votesHelpful: but to me this is a no brainer: denial is a stupid mechanic and I'm glad it is out.\n\n4. The game is financially very genorous. For 30$ (20$ on steam right now
votesTotal: which is insane) you get every god in the game and every future god released. Sure
votesFunny: you can argue that the heroes in DoTA are free
commentsCount: fair enough
column16: but in comparison to LoL this is a huge upgrade. Additionally
column17: you can also easily unlock every god using in game currency. Hi Rez also very regularly has promotions where you can earn premium currency for free. And it is worth it because the skins and voicepacks in the game are AWESOME\n\n5. Speaking of Voice packs: the VGS system is amazing. Rather than wasting time typing in game
column18: a few quick button presses will inform your team about almost anything you could want to say. "Enemy missing left" "Ward the fire giant" "I'll gank right lane" "Save yourselves" "Ultimate is ready" "Chase the enemy" "Retreat left jungle" "You Rock" "Please??" etcetcetcetc. Each god
column19: and many skins have unique voicepacks
column20: making the whole thing extra cool\n\n6. Unlike most MOBAs
column21: Smite has MANY game modes and they are all popular and all worth playing. This allows me to enjoy smite with my competitive friends
column22: my noob girlfriend and my casual gamer friends. The game is balanced around conquest (the main competitive game mode with 3 lanes etc) as it should be
column23: but the other game modes get lots of love as well.\n\nIn conclusion
column24: I have played over 2000 hours of smite and look forward to playing 2000 more. 10/10

reviewText: After constantly getting frustrated with League of Legends, I found Smite. Smite is a very rewarding game, in that you are able to progress with each character you select. Getting my first level 10 mastery for a god was a very happy day, as I was able to see the work I put into getting to that point. You can buy the skins and chests in the game by simply logging in daily and playing for favor, but sometimes you need to pay if you really want a nice skin. The seasonal events are great and rewarding. You feel more in control of your character in this third person action MOBA, rather than a top-down style. I'd say, give it a try, and you may just get hooked.

reviewText:
WHY YOU MIGHT WANT TO PLAY SMITE
- Third person, over the shoulder perspective. This is pretty big, and in my opinion, the game's biggest selling point. With one or two exceptions, abilities are all skillshots, and autoattacks have to be aimed. Direct control over your character is a much more enjoyable control scheme than click to move. (The downside to this is that you can't switch control or move the camera, so you'll never see a character like Lone Druid).
- Multiple game modes. If you like the aesthetic and controls but hate the idea of playing a traditional 3-lane 5v5 matchup, you can still hop into Arena (5v5 deathmatch. Giant circle, kill the enemy team more than they kill you), Assault (Smite's ARAM mode, 5v5 with a single lane and gods randomly assigned), Seige (4v4, two lanes with a single objective), or Joust (3v3, single lane with small jungles). There's also the Match of the Day, which can be anything from a 4v4 match on the normal 5v5 map, or Arena with 80% cooldown reduction and inifinte mana.
- Generous handouts. For $30, you can get all current and future gods. Every god has one recolor, and three mastery" skins (gold
hoursPlayed: available for purchase with in game money. If you log in every day for a week
voteText: you'll get a total of 50 gems
helpfulPercent: and there are frequently sales and free gem weekends.\n- The VGS. Enemy leave your lane? Tap out VFF and your character will call out "Enemy missing!". The VGS is a convienience you won't know you're missing until you load up any other competitive game without the same level of communication tools.\n- Autobuy / Autolevel. If you don't want to sweat about what you should build or what skills you should level

votesTotal: the autobuild is totally fine.\n- Quicker matches. The typical 5v5 match takes about 20 minutes

reviewText:
Been playing Smite for almost 3 years now. It is awesome.
I have dabbled in many MOBAs (DoTA, LoL, Awesomenauts, Monday Night Combat) and have enjoyed all of them, but there are just a number of things that set Smite apart:

1. The theme is awesome. Ever since I played Age of Mythology as a kid I've really liked mythology as a theme. These gods are just so memorable and interesting. Smite really lets them come to life, while also introducing you to many gods you have never even heard of.

2. It's all a matter of perspective. At the end of the day, games are meant to be fun. And killing someone in Smite just feels SO MUCH MORE satisfying than it does in other MOBAs. Landing skillshots in 3rd person is much more viceral and impactful than it is in top down MOBAs.

3. Good mechanics, without cumbersome mechanics: Unlike the big two (no names needed), Smite is not cumbersome. Buying an item does not require you to know what other 4 items need to be combined to make it. Beginners can simply turn on an auto buy" feature in order to ease the learning curve. To buy stuff you just go to base and buy it. simple as that. No need for secret shops in the jungle
recommended: two core mechanics: last hitting and denial are wonderfully handled: Last hitting gives you more gold
hoursPlayed: but you also get gold for being close to enemies as they die
voteText: making farming less of a hassle. And
helpfulPercent: more importantly: there is no denial. I know some DoTA players have strong feelings about this
votesHelpful: but to me this is a no brainer: denial is a stupid mechanic and I'm glad it is out.\n\n4. The game is financially very genorous. For 30$ (20$ on steam right now
votesTotal: which is insane) you get every god in the game and every future god released. Sure
votesFunny: you can argue that the heroes in DoTA are free
commentsCount: fair enough
column16: but in comparison to LoL this is a huge upgrade. Additionally
column17: you can also easily unlock every god using in game currency. Hi Rez also very regularly has promotions where you can earn premium currency for free. And it is worth it because the skins and voicepacks in the game are AWESOME\n\n5. Speaking of Voice packs: the VGS system is amazing. Rather than wasting time typing in game
column18: a few quick button presses will inform your team about almost anything you could want to say. "Enemy missing left" "Ward the fire giant" "I'll gank right lane" "Save yourselves" "Ultimate is ready" "Chase the enemy" "Retreat left jungle" "You Rock" "Please??" etcetcetcetc. Each god
column19: and many skins have unique voicepacks
column20: making the whole thing extra cool\n\n6. Unlike most MOBAs
column21: Smite has MANY game modes and they are all popular and all worth playing. This allows me to enjoy smite with my competitive friends
column22: my noob girlfriend and my casual gamer friends. The game is balanced around conquest (the main competitive game mode with 3 lanes etc) as it should be
column23: but the other game modes get lots of love as well.\n\nIn conclusion
column24: I have played over 2000 hours of smite and look forward to playing 2000 more. 10/10

reviewText:
SMITE is a fun game with a ♥♥♥♥ ton of gods to choose from. From Medusa to Loki and Arachne to Zeus, these gods are balanced and all fun to play (we don't talk about Vamana.....).

The community is great, consisting of mostly friendly people (let's be honest, there's always going to be ♥♥♥♥♥♥ people in every community). The game updates regularily, bringing us new gods quite often (which can cause a sudden storm of players to get online to get a chance to play the newest god.

I've met some great people playing SMITE and I've been friends with them for a while now. The community of SMITE is MUCH healthier than that of Leauge and DOTA, for many reasons.

If you're looking for a new game to play with other people, are interested in mythology, or want a break from DOTA or LoL, SMITE is the game for you.

Have fun and be nice!

reviewText:
CASUAL GAMERS LISTEN UP! You can come play this, I promise

Now, why do I start that way? Because let's be honest, hardcore competitive gamers are already playing the games they want to play. Anyone NEW coming by this game, chances are, will be a casual gamer. And that's not a BAD thing. You can still be GOOD and have FUN without being super competitive.

This community isn't very toxic. Especially compared to other MOBAs. You have 74 unique Gods an Goddesses to choose from.
It isn't THAT hard to get into. It's a bit confusing AT FIRST, but you pick up on things quickly. Lots of videos on youtube you can look up and see whatever it is you don't know.

I DEFINITELY say try this, even if you have had bad experiences with MOBAs or have never played one; this game will be a good experience regardless. I love how the Gods/Goddess' are designed. Love the graphics. And I like the community.

reviewText: It's been almost three years since I have stumbled onto this masterpiece of a MOBA. My review alone wouldn't do this game justice. The passion I have for the company Hi-Rez, the community, and the pro league is near and dear to my heart. The amount time I have sunk into this game is something I really don't want to know. From 3rd person action view and the 7 different gamemodes like conquest, arena, and MOTD (Match of the Day), to the 70+ playable gods that are still growing in numbers to this day and are all available under the god pack for $30 (best deal EVER). The game is updated every two weeks with incoming balance changes, new gods/goddesses, skins, and a lot more. From the variety of things like youtube, twitch, reddit, and gurus out there, the amount of content associated with this game is enormous. I highly recommend people who are intrested or are on the fence about the game to watch the new  Smite cinematic trailer  or  god reveal  for Amaterasu before jumping into a game of explosive enjoyment.\n\nI hope this helped some people out on making a decision and happy smiting!

reviewText:
If you've heard of games, you've had to have heard of Smite. I've not played nearly as long as other people but I believe I know enough to make a review. Now if you're into games like LoL, WoW, and Dota but want a three-dimensional spin on them, this is your game. It has the strategic, action, competitive nature of all of those games with a great combat system. Level up and put points into each of your abilities to become the strongest on your team. Also earn money along the way to buy equipment and buffs. The controls are tight and the characters are awesome. Pick between Artemis or Thor, there is no punishment for picking either. Every character is useful at something and can destroy you in an instant if you're not careful. There is also a great variety of modes to choose from such as Arena, Conquest, Capture the Flag, and etc... The downsides are that the chat is rarely used. And if you're on a team of noobs, more often than not you're going to lose. But other than that the game looks great, sounds great, plays great, and runs great even on my ancient fossil.

Overall RogueTom gives this game an   8/10
We use Gods on this battlefield.

reviewText:
I have played Smite since the closed beta and have sunk almost a thousand hours into it prior to the Steam release.

Smite is a quickly growing Third-Person action oriented Moba that puts an interesting spin on the genre that is not just a gimmick to attract short term players.
The methods of control are more (WASD and Third-Person Camera) are far more intuitive than other games in the genre if you have played any other Third-Person action game before.
Smite also offers a variety of more casual game modes, combined with the intuitive controls this lowers the barrier of entry significantly, making it a great game for people that want to get into the Moba genre but are afraid of the steep learning curve most games have.

Despite of it's friendly early learning curve Smite has a huge skill ceiling and offers much at an endgame level. Apart from more common Moba skills, like map awareness and tactical awareness, Smite also requires you to hit much more skillshots than other Mobas, which makes it interesting for more serious players, potentially with a background in shooter games

Pros
friendly learning curve
intuitive controls
good tutorials for new players
Ultimate god pack (all current and future gods for one price)
casual game modes
high skill ceiling
skillshots
interesting god design
growing e-sports scene
A lot of these cons are technical and will hopefully be resolved soon

Cons
bad matchmaking
bad servers (a persistent issue that keeps coming and going again)
annyoing idiots (like every Moba, Smite sadly hasn't been able to get rid of this)
Who is this game for?:
Anyone who is interested in the Moba genre and is looking for a more casual experience.
Anyone who is looking for a familiar control scheme and more skillshots.
Anyone who wants to play a competitive Moba with a different design.

reviewText:
A truly nice and lovely game!

I've been playing SMITE since the Closed Beta and already have over 750 hours on my back and  I have to say, it never really got boring to me!
+++
+ Voicepacks: They do a great job and you really have the opportunity to communicate good with your team!
The variations for each GOD  that there is an own voicepack to buy (with Gems) makes it even more funnier to talk with your allies!
+ I really love the company HiRez-Studions, they do a great job with everything (except one thing) and they still have the time to do funny videos that they can upload on YouTube then!
+ Aswell as the pantheons:
To explore all the different GODS, to read the lore and just getting known the varieties that there are!
+ The Gameplay is nice to, teaming up with friends or non-friends isn't that much of a different if you have the right people to fight your enemy team and the dynamic in Third-Person makes it much more epic to fight!

---
- The matchmaking for League (Ranked Games for some people) is still a problem. Getting queued with people who just started to play League Matches sometimes makes me feel sad and is a thing that the company needs to fix! ;)

There is nothing more to say for me, 9/10 SMITE from HiRez-Studios!

reviewText:
Smite is a really cool MOBA that involves teamplay and strategy. It has different characters from different mythologies and a lot of different modes that provide different gameplay exerience. The game always adds new gods, skins and events that extend the playtime and prevents the gameplay from getting boring.

The only problem that I have with this game is that the community is a bit toxic (Sometimes you get the one that spams the chat with you needing to delete smite and die in the corner and sometimes you get the friendly guy and the one that wants to help) but generally it is okay. You can find a friend or two and play with them in a team.

Personally I enjoyed every bit of my gameplay of Smite and I would recommend it for people looking for an addicting game.

reviewText: Are you a fan of MOBAs? Yes? Fantastic. Play Smite. This game is the most glorious, entertaining and overwhelmingly addicting MOBA I have yet to play. I have played League, DotA, Heroes of the Storm etc. but this one truly takes the cake. The different game modes make it extremely diverse and entertaining to play for extended periods of time. The game rewards you for coming back to play on a daily basis with in game currency as well as rewards. The best part about it is that it is completely free as long as you are willing to put in the work! I gaurentee you if you download this game and give it an honest chance you will enjoy it. See you in the battleground of the Gods. (PS if you are into mythology this game is a real treat}

reviewText:
So here is my Review on Smite
(now understand i have played LoL, Dota2,  and heroes of the storm so I'm not new to MOBA's but i am new to Smite)

Now after the tutorial i joinid my first real match and my team destroyed, i expected the other team to spam chat how they should have won and who made them lose and what did they do call a gg and said good work to me for how i played for a beginier I stepped away with my mind blown that there was no ♥♥♥♥♥ing about how they lost and who made them lose.BY FAR THE BEST MOBA COMMUNITE I HAVE EVER SEEN. Dota the vets can be ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s to you and there is always that one kid who gets real ♥♥♥♥♥♥ he lost. LoL is the same thing but more Blaming eachother. Heroes of the Storm came close with every now and again that one control freak who gets ♥♥♥♥♥♥ when you don't listen to him.There is also the disconnecting system unlike Dota with it's a bot will take over until he recconects well in this in a Co-op match against bots if someone leaves on your team they just remove one Bot from the enmy team during other matches however there is no system for a bot to take over but i do feel like there is some kind of equalizing system in place to enhance the teammissing one or more men down.

Now the Third person aiming mechanic works a lot better then the previous MOBAs that did similar. Replacing the classic point and click you get a better control of your character I feel then Dota and LoL. With the aiming of your basic attack mechanic i feel that it doesn't give players a great edge like in Dota how your ranged character at about mid range never missed with there basic attack.Smite you can hide behind your grunts and use them like basic attack shields. Skills I feel have changed thanks to the third person aiming, Such as Sun Wukong the monkey king a playable character in Smite has a skill that transforms him into three seprate creatures the creature he becomes depends on how far you aim the attack, Again giving a strong since of control.

Finally is the items, Now the items Range from a lot of different stat boosts from a Speed Buff to Magic damgae buff but unlike Dota were you only get cash from killing a minion our enemy you get cash and EXP for assists as well in Smite. Plus unlike Dota with it's Items that can make a character stupidly strong our make others seem really week in comparison Smite has a balanced choice of items that won't make you want to give up half way throught.

Well thats my review I have wasted enought time on writing this and I would perfer to get back to playing this game is by far in my opinion a 10/10 IGN would bang again

reviewText:
I've played over 1,500 hours of SMITE before the steam release and I could play 1,500 more.  This game in a short summary is the most skilled MOBA you will ever play, nothing is an auto lock ability and auto attacks even take skill to hit.

Pros and Cons:

Pros:  -Multiple gamemodes for different types of players (you don't ever have to play the classic 3 lane map if you don't want).

-All gods are usable, meaning that no ones is complete garbage and you will be shunned or hated on for using him.

-The META is constantly changing, always keeping laning and jungling fresh.

-Every god can be used in every lane if you are good enough, and no one will be mad if you do use a Tank in mid lane.

-The store currency to buy skins can be obtained through special events and through weekly awards, meaning if you are patient enough, you can get a skin you want.

-Game is completely free to play, you will never have to spend money on it if you don't want to.
________________________________________________________________________________

Cons:  -All new gods on release are either: 1. completely broken and will infinently destroy you, or 2. super garbage and need a buff immediatly.

-Some gods are better than others, such as Bellona, Au Puch and Khepri, and Hi-Rez won't balance them.

-Servers are constantly kicking you out of games and going offline randomly.

-Community is very toxic, luckily you can mute people though.

-If someone does something wrong, Jungle always gets blamed, so you better be damn good at Jungle unless you want to get roasted hard core.

-Game does not have an in-game voice chat, you have to download an external client called Curse" to talk to people in League matches.

-Favor (the in-game currency to buy gods) is extremely hard to obtain
date:
making you want to buy the godpack more and more so you don't have to deal with trying to get it.
________________________________________________________________________________

Overall
recommended: this is my most played and favorite game of all time
hoursPlayed: and I most likely will never stop playing it
voteText: no matter how unbalanced Bellona is.\n\nOVERALL RATING FOR SMITE: 9.25/10"

reviewText: Ok first off, personal rating of 10/10. Absolutely WONDERFUL game. Now I'll say this, What this did right unlike League of Legends (Which I played and hated almost instantly) was that the tutorial character, the one you're first shown and get used to over the course of almost an hour long tutorial, was ACTUALLY available to use after the tutorial. Sometimes it's the little things ya know? Other than that, if you WANT to play this game. IF it interests you enough to download it. YOU. WILL. SUCK. MASSIVE. DONG. End of story. It will take you a bit of practice to even start to get better at this game. Be patient and this game will show you a wonderful thing to play. It's hard. It will make you mad often. BUT. The game itself will love you if you give it your time. When you get your first double, triple, quadra, and ESPECIALLY penta kill, it's an AMAZING feeling. Hell, I'm about 160 hours in and I've only gotten TWO quadra kills. No penta yet.\nI will say this downside of the game though. IT SINCERELY WANTS YOUR MONEY. But if you can deal with playing and earning things instead of buying them this is an AMAZING free to play game. Or you know what, the creators work hard on this. There was a major outage of all Hi-rez servers in North america and Europe. They fixed ALL of them within FOUR hours. Anyone Remember RUST? Yeah. That game was unplayable for months. If you feel like it, and really enjoy the game, buy some gems or some merch to give some money to the awesome people at Hi-Rez who work hard on this game.

reviewText:
SMITE, where do I even begin? My friend introduced me to this game back in the summer and I didn't have my hopes up because I'm not the type of guy to get involved in MOBAs. But then, my life changed. SMITE isn't like other MOBAs. It is one of the best MOBAs (in my opinion) out there. Now let me start with the Pros and Cons of SMITE.

Pros:
- Amazing Gameplay
- Mostly Friendly Community
- Easy Way to Get The Latest Skins
- Constantly Updated With New Content
- Friendly to New Players
- 6 Fun Gamemodes (Arena - 5v5, Joust - 3v3, Conquest - 5v5, Assault - 5v5 (random god), Clash - 5v5, Siege - 4v4)

Cons:
-Players Are Better Than You
- Queue Times (Mainly are OK in the longrun, but some can take FOREVER)

Conclusion:

SMITE is a game I would recommend to ALL new and old MOBA players. You are sure to have an amazing time.

reviewText: Where do I begin? Okay, so I now have over 110 hours on the Steam client and had somewhere between 300-550 hours on the original client. Now, I will say that there are negative aspects to the game. However these are more particular to MOBAs in general and less about Smite. Matchmaking in League, Dota, (I assume Heroes of the Storm, but never played and never heard anything about its matchmaking) and Smite is no exception. If you're trying to teach a friend to play without making a smurf account, well, it's really REALLY hard. Since a party will always play against people around the highest party member's level, it usually results in absolute domination by the opposing team because you have at least one team mate (Being your friend you are trying to teach) who barely understands the game. This is less of a problem for experienced players of other MOBAs like LoL or Dota, however not unheard of either. The grind to level 30 is also astonishing long. I should mention that even with all this time played, I am still a level 25. I've been playing since the closed beta in October 2012. Sure, I've been playing off and on in that time, however, that doesn't change the fact that I have a ♥♥♥♥ ton of time in the game. The only reason this is a problem is that you can't play ranked until you are level 30. If you're playing a normal game in the premier" gamemode Conquest
hoursPlayed: and overall bad team players. I personally recommend that if you do play conquest
voteText: play with a friend who is on or above your skill level. If you're alone

The game is a downright amazing game that I would recommend to almost anyone. The players themselves are the bad part. This isn't even mentioning the totally awesome concept of playing as freaking GODS. "Oh

reviewText:
Scroll down past the paragraph for TL;DR!

This game is an amazing MOBA. Definitely better than the more mainstream MOBAS (looking at you, DOTA 2 / League of Legends). Most MOBAs tend to bore me and infuriate me, but this one doesn't feel like a MOBA and that you're more in control than the click-fest the other MOBAs bring - plus the community is INFINITELY less toxic than other MOBAs (mainly because toxic behavior is not tolerated by HiRez or most of the players). Instead of an RTS stand-point, it uses a 3rd person action perspective. The gods are all fairly unique and they all have the potential to be amazing and game changing while focusing on teamwork and strategy. The nice thing about this game is that you don't really have to pay a single penny to play and it's not pay to win. The company is actually good enough to award you with their premium currency for daily log-ins (days 6 & 7), and with tons of events. I would suggest to get the Ultimate God Pack since you'll receive all 71 gods PLUS every single god that comes after this, and with the Japanese gods coming by on January 2016 (other pantheons include Roman, Greek, Egyptian, Chinese, Mayan, Hindu and Norse gods), it is an amazing investment (especially on this Thanksgiving weekend and periodically where they discount it at 33% off) and the premium currency can get you cool skins, voice packs among other cool stuff.

In conclusion: This game is a must have for anyone who likes MOBAs or actually dislikes the traditional MOBAs (like I did), but wants to give the genre one more chance.

~~ TL;DR ~~

reviewText: SMITE is a 3rd person moba. Simple? Simple. Well, your 3rd person viewpoint in this game is a lot different. Unlike HoTS, League of Legends, or Dota 2, SMITE does not use its same camera angle, and instead is directed behind the god you are controlling. SMITE has characters from different cultures such as Greek gods like Apollo and Artemis, or Chinese gods like Ne Zha and Huo Yi. Gameplay is very different from other mobas because you are viewing from a different angle, making skillshots feel very different than before if you have played from the LoL/Dota 2/HoTS viewpoint. Also, autoattacks are aimed too, making last hitting for gold or pushing more satisfying. Now, onto my opinion.\n\nPersonally, I really enjoy this game and very surprised I didn't try this game out earlier. This game has very satisfying and refreshing gameplay, and the gods have very fun kits to play around with. Personally, I found that my favorite assassin right now has to be Bastet. Don't look over this game if you are trying to looking for a new free-to-play game to try out, because you won't be disapppointed at all.

reviewText:
I just added this game to my Steam library but I have played SMite for well over 1000+ hours. I have played DOTA, HOS and LOL and other the HOS I quickly got feed up with the isometric style of MOBA.

First off Smites biggest selling point is that it is in 3rd person. That is a game changer. It is more responsive and the action is so much faster. Also the cosmetic skins are amazing and have only gotten better and better. Not only that Hi Rez updates the skins of old Gods over time.

I spend most of my time playing Arena and although I play Conquest, Arena is so much more fun for me. I main Ymir and Ares both 10 mastery, it is the first time I have found myself truly enjoying a support, tank roll in any game ever. Also support matters and can carry if you are good enough. Knowing every role can shine.

The game is free so there is simply not a reason to try it. Also the Ultimate God pack gives you access to all present and future Gods. I was salty that they have offered this deal post Beta but you know what, it brings in more players and that is great for Smite. Had Smite launched before or at the same time as DOTA or LOL it would be the number on MOBA in the world.

Two more points, Tribes is getting an update because of Smite, the game many claim killed Tribes. Hi Rez needs to make money and no game developers do no exist simply to cater to entitled gamers. Smite has been so sucessful that Hi rez can divert resources to do just that and has. Secondly Hi Rez is constantly doing in game events for gems which you use to by skins and voice packs as well as Gods. Never use gems for Gods because you can use the free currency to do that. Use your gems for skins and voice packs.

I recommend this game as fully as I could ever recommend anything. If you find COnquest getting you down try Arean and yes it is okay to only play that and MOTD. It is your game time so your rules. Please join me in Smite it is a bannar time.

reviewText:
I've played over 1,500 hours of SMITE before the steam release and I could play 1,500 more.  This game in a short summary is the most skilled MOBA you will ever play, nothing is an auto lock ability and auto attacks even take skill to hit.

Pros and Cons:

Pros:  -Multiple gamemodes for different types of players (you don't ever have to play the classic 3 lane map if you don't want).

-All gods are usable, meaning that no ones is complete garbage and you will be shunned or hated on for using him.

-The META is constantly changing, always keeping laning and jungling fresh.

-Every god can be used in every lane if you are good enough, and no one will be mad if you do use a Tank in mid lane.

-The store currency to buy skins can be obtained through special events and through weekly awards, meaning if you are patient enough, you can get a skin you want.

-Game is completely free to play, you will never have to spend money on it if you don't want to.
________________________________________________________________________________

Cons:  -All new gods on release are either: 1. completely broken and will infinently destroy you, or 2. super garbage and need a buff immediatly.

-Some gods are better than others, such as Bellona, Au Puch and Khepri, and Hi-Rez won't balance them.

-Servers are constantly kicking you out of games and going offline randomly.

-Community is very toxic, luckily you can mute people though.

-If someone does something wrong, Jungle always gets blamed, so you better be damn good at Jungle unless you want to get roasted hard core.

-Game does not have an in-game voice chat, you have to download an external client called Curse" to talk to people in League matches.

-Favor (the in-game currency to buy gods) is extremely hard to obtain
date:
making you want to buy the godpack more and more so you don't have to deal with trying to get it.
________________________________________________________________________________

Overall
recommended: this is my most played and favorite game of all time
hoursPlayed: and I most likely will never stop playing it
voteText: no matter how unbalanced Bellona is.\n\nOVERALL RATING FOR SMITE: 9.25/10"

reviewText:
Playing since closed Beta. This game has had a very nice transformation from the game and skins. The amount of Gods avalible is great so far. The game is a bit different to other MOBA´s from tactical and gameplay point of view.

You only have skillshots!
YES! Only Skillshots! (Ecxept some Ultimates)
You even need to aim with autoattacks O M G!

Which makes it a very skillfull MOBA compared to others. Also the 3rd Person makes ganking become a much more fearfull threat since you need to turn around to check your back sometimes.

Also the buiseness model of Hirez seems very fair compared to the competition.
You have your Skins you can buy for ingame cash but you also can get those gems for free on speciall events or if you login once a day on the 6th an 7th login you shall get a bit gems as reward... which makes it even possible to get a skin or a viocepack without spending cash after some time playing.

I can only recommend to try it out and train a bit some champions. Since it is heavy skillshot based it takes time to get used to it.

The special offer 16 USD for all existing and future god i can recommend.... Fair Price for such a good offer. Again... Compare to the competition. ;)

reviewText:
#Summary
---------------------------------------
I AM DEFINITIVELY RECOMMENDING THIS GAME!!

Skillshot heavy, 3rd person 3D MOBA. The USP of this game is its perspective which includes some implications and is the main compositor of the game play. However, you will feel at home when you played other MOBAs before. If you are new, you will get a lot of integrated support.

SKILL-SHOOTING - hitting an enemy with any attack requires you to aim and calculate properly. No highlight - cast - hit!

STALKING - In addition to line-of-sight, field-of-view becomes a major issue. GANK!!!

ANCIENT GOD SETTING - Besides cool characters, this will teach you a lot of interesting lore!

SUPPORT - big and growing playerbase, frequent updates, integrated twich, tutorials, prizes, achievements, etc.



#Game Modes
---------------------------------------
Different game modes include:

CONQUEST - 5v5 classic MOBA, 3 lane, jungle, with the main objective to destroy the enemy titan"

JOUST - 3v3 reduced MOBA
hoursPlayed: "destroy the enemy titan"\n\nARENA - 5v5 pure team fight

column17: 2 lane

column19:
"destroy the enemy titan"

MATCH OF THE DAY - changes on a daily basis


LEAGUES - joust (1v1) and conquest (5v5).



#Character Classes
---------------------------------------
Select amongst different main classes that share some characteristics (ofc
column20:
there are exceptions/hybrids)

HUNTER - your classic carry. Usually ranged and basic-attack heavy. You like this class when you know how to aim!

GUARDIAN - your classic tank. It usually comes with a lot of CC so you are the one to set up the team fights.

ASSASSIN - meant for taking out a single enemy target fast. Get in - kill - get out. Usually melee.

WARRIOR - hybrid between guardian and assassin. Tanky
column21: does damage
column22: has some CC
column23: usually melee.\n\nMAGE - comes with powerful spells
column24: your classic ability-based nuker
column26:
and supporter.



#Free 2 Play
---------------------------------------
No pay2win (not possible to buy any advantage for real money!). Free character rotation that changes weekly. You gain "favor" by completing matches
column27: which lets you buy gods permanently. Alternatively
column30: voice packs and other purely cosmetic elements may be purchased for "gems" which can be bought for real currency. You are given the opportunity to buy the "ultimate god pack"
column31:
which will unlock any present and future gods permanently.



#Overall Rating
---------------------------------------
GRAPHICS - compared to beta improved a lot! Beautiful models
column33: effects. Nothing to complain here - good!\n\nSOUNDS - epic music
column35: some character's voice packs suck - average!\n\nCOMMUNITY - customizable player profile
column38:
tutorials etc. - very good!

FEATURES - branched communication system that lets teammates know what you want - very good!


GAME EXPERIENCE - very playable

reviewText: A very enjoyable free 3D MOBA from HiRezStudios. Its gameplay is fun and rewarding as players control gods from various mythologies (Greek, Indian, Norse, Chinese, etc.) in a third person perspective. SMITE has many modes to play, both casual and competitive, and a fair business model like that of League of Legends, with players earning currency from playing games and also being given the option to pay real money for skins and gods. The friendly developers, frequent events, and artistic design complete the experience. I highly recommend it for fans of MOBAs and beginners alike.\n\nI've played this game since closed beta (2012-2013) and it has grown a lot since then. It is active in the esports scene despite being relatively new, putting on events and tournaments as large as those for CS:GO or LoL. Its future is very promising (as shown by its Steam and Xbox One port); SMITE has been one of the few games that I have consistently enjoyed playing for a long time.

reviewText:
It's League of Legends for people who hate League of Legends, basically.

Pros:
- Community isn't -as- toxic as LoL
- 3rd Person POV is pretty unique for an MOBA
- Not pay-to-win (Though the Ult. God Pack is an awesome deal)
- Have you seen the goddesses (and other models)? Absolutely gorgeous (most of them, at least)
- No, I don't just mean Neith's rack that she loves to shake around
- Fairly easy to earn Favor/Gems for new gods or skins

Cons:
- Some of the skins are less than gorgeous
- Community is still toxic
- If you're -not- into rack-shaking...
- I hear the Customer Service is pretty bad, but I don't know from personal experience
- Some gods feel completely useless, others are incredibly overpowered, some are simply too complicated (or simply too simple) - tl;dr please balance out ur gods better hi-rez

Overall, coming from someone who loathes LoL and other MOBAs like it, I love SMITE. It feels more like an RPG-style PVP than it does an MOBA, and the lore behind all the Gods/Goddesses is a really neat aspect that a lot of MOBAs are missing nowadays (I'm looking at YOU, League of Legends).

reviewText:
I just added this game to my Steam library but I have played SMite for well over 1000+ hours. I have played DOTA, HOS and LOL and other the HOS I quickly got feed up with the isometric style of MOBA.

First off Smites biggest selling point is that it is in 3rd person. That is a game changer. It is more responsive and the action is so much faster. Also the cosmetic skins are amazing and have only gotten better and better. Not only that Hi Rez updates the skins of old Gods over time.

I spend most of my time playing Arena and although I play Conquest, Arena is so much more fun for me. I main Ymir and Ares both 10 mastery, it is the first time I have found myself truly enjoying a support, tank roll in any game ever. Also support matters and can carry if you are good enough. Knowing every role can shine.

The game is free so there is simply not a reason to try it. Also the Ultimate God pack gives you access to all present and future Gods. I was salty that they have offered this deal post Beta but you know what, it brings in more players and that is great for Smite. Had Smite launched before or at the same time as DOTA or LOL it would be the number on MOBA in the world.

Two more points, Tribes is getting an update because of Smite, the game many claim killed Tribes. Hi Rez needs to make money and no game developers do no exist simply to cater to entitled gamers. Smite has been so sucessful that Hi rez can divert resources to do just that and has. Secondly Hi Rez is constantly doing in game events for gems which you use to by skins and voice packs as well as Gods. Never use gems for Gods because you can use the free currency to do that. Use your gems for skins and voice packs.

I recommend this game as fully as I could ever recommend anything. If you find COnquest getting you down try Arean and yes it is okay to only play that and MOTD. It is your game time so your rules. Please join me in Smite it is a bannar time.

reviewText: Smite is a Free To Play 3rd person action MOBA that centers around ancient gods competing against eachother.  Want to watch Sun Wukong put a beating down on Odin?  No problem.  Want to watch Loki stab Aphroditie in the back?  Done deal.  Want to see Zeus electrify everyone and everything?  Most definately.  With the $30 godpack available, you can have all gods at your fingertips for the most reasonable price in MOBA history.  I have personally put more time into this game than any other (I've only had Smite on my Steam for about a month), which says a lot considering I have massive game ADD.  Try this game, but like most MOBAS, don't get discouraged if you have a few bad matches.  Go to the reddit for beginners guides, ask your teammates for help, and ignore the haters.  A must own if you have any skill with a mouse and keyboard.  (controller supported as well)

reviewText:
I used to play this game in the beta, until I got the d3d9.dll error, a quite famous error. I checked the internet for hours, tried many fixes but I had no luck. There were many complains about this on the SMITE forum, but the admins never responded or fixed it....

A few weeks ago I saw SMITE on Steam, and decided to give it another spin. And it worked! So here we are, playing again.

There are enough comments on what SMITE is, what it does and how it works, so I will refrain from repeating the list. Instead, I will give you the recommendation to play it. It is free, so there is absolutely nothing holding you back to try. Yes, it is a MOBA, and to be honest, I'm fairly tired of MOBAs (after playing HoN, DotA1, DotA 2 and LoL). However, this game does not feel like a MOBA at all. It feels like an RPG/hack&slash game. So if you like both genres, or just one, give it a try! You will not be disappointed :)

reviewText:
Yeah, this game is great. A 3rd person view is a new thing in MOBA games. I can write a poem about this game, but it's done by commentators under me. So, just pros&cons:
Pros:
+ Great graphics.
+ Beautiful community.
+ Great supports (and all system in case).
+ Very-very fast matches (thanks to 3rd pers.)
+ No big need in donate.
Some cons:
- Imbalance new gods (ye-ye, someone isn't hurry to fix this)
- Rare inadequate ruiners, but there are not so much of them.
- People, who picking gods, and playing like a kids (0:5, smite top plays detected)
But in case, this game is truly great.
9,3/10, must play

reviewText:
SMITE is one of the best MOBAs out there in my opinion, mostly because of the immense amount of variety in all of the god's abilities, looks, and overall feel, but from other features like the third person camera angles that makes it more action-packed compared to other MOBAs,the fact that the gods come from various religions, countries, and mythology, resulting in more variety, and the large community of over 10 million players, meaning it won't be that hard to find a match.

I play SMITE on Xbox One and on PC, and find that the experience and players are great, there is virtually NO noticeable server lag, and that the visuals are outstanding. In case your wondering, no, the store doesn't allow players to just get over-powered abilities with in-game currency purchased with real money, it simply allows players to buy skins and different gods faster.

I find that the different god classes have different pros and cons, meaning there will be more teamwork, and the addition of the surrender vote and the removal of a leave game option is a great idea, and is very under-rated in games. However, I find that sometimes when I'm frustrated while playing a game of SMITE, the players that aren't having a bad experience vote not to surrender, resulting in some players not having a good experience.

This game, like all others, does have cons. Most games last at least 20 minutes, so if you're a busy person, you may want to stay away from this addicting game. Also, there aren't many game modes, and although the Game of the Day feature is smart, it seems like close to zero thought was put into these daily game modes.

Overall this game is a great Free-to-play game and gets a 9.2 in my book, only because of the reasons above. The gameplay and graphics are fast and steady, and they're always adding new gods. with over 70 gods and counting, I can't wait to see where this game goes.



System Specs: Dell XPS 8700 w/ Intel i5 @ 3.10GHz, 12.0 GB RAM, 64x OS, Nvidia GeForce GT 635 w/1GB DDR, Windows 10 Home.
